headline: Republicans mostly silent as millions of Americans protest Trump on No Kings day
summary:
• No Kings rallies and marches against Trump administration policies took place on Saturday as the third mass mobilization since Trump's return, featuring constitutional references and inflatable costumes rather than confrontational tactics
• Trump administration engaged in counter-programming and mockery, with JD Vance and Pete Hegseth attending a Marine Corps event while the president downplayed the protests
• Republican leaders remained mostly silent on Saturday despite earlier attempts to characterize the protests as 'hate America' events involving communists, Hamas sympathizers, and far-left extremists
• Controversy emerged over live-fire military demonstration at Camp Pendleton that Governor Gavin Newsom said created public safety risks by closing a major interstate highway
• Right-leaning media outlets claimed Soros-connected foundations funded the protests and that pro-Palestine organizers infiltrated the No Kings movement
